title: MBUK June 2021 issue on sale now. Subscribe and get a pair of Madison Flux shorts!
content:
Fun for pinners and pootlers alike, this issue MBUK begins the hunt for Britain’s best blue trail. There are also tests of £1,000ish bikes, clipless pedals and enduro helmets, plus the team explain how to rectify six common riding errors. Ride wise, they head to Bedgebury Forest in Kent and The Bull Track in East Sussex, show you how to have a great weekend on the North York Moors and check out what’s going on at Caersws in Mid Wales. There’s tons more besides, from servicing SPDs to maximising your lunch break. Pick up your copy now!

  • Subscribe to Mountain Biking UK to receive your free gift as well as discounts and more

Blues cruise

You can’t beat a good blue trail. Designed to be accessible to beginners, but also packed with fun features for more experienced riders, the best blues are fun for all riders. We’re scouring the UK to find the best blue trails and in this issue it’s England’s turn.

One-grand wonders

In this month’s biketest the testers see whether you can get a trail-slaying demon for under a grand or whether you need to spend a little more to get the most bang for your buck. The team reviews three affordable hardtails head to head.

Clipless pedals on test

A must for XC, DH and enduro racers, clipless pedals are designed with aggressive riding in mind. In this grouptest, our testers have put together a selection of nine of the best clipless pedals on the market in a bid to find the most secure, stable and confidence-inspiring pair you can buy.

Power hour

James Vincent and Pat Campbell-Jenner are on a mission to find out exactly how much awesome riding you can fit into your lunch break. In a time when we’re all keen to make the most of the time we’ve got, these two Lake District lads aim to prove that it doesn’t always require a huge roadtrip to get out on the trails.

Bedgebury Forest and The Bull Track trail crew

Ed Thomsett heads over to the South East to check out a pair of riding locations that are making a big splash on the Kent and Sussex border – Bedgebury Forest and The Bull Track Bike Park. These places are proof of the healthy state of the modern MTB scene and show that you can have as much fun in the home counties as you can in the Scottish Highlands.

And that’s not all…

This issue of MBUK is jam-packed with all the latest and greatest bikes, product reviews and news stories from the mountain biking world. There’s a brand new e-bike from Specialized and forks from RockShox and Fox, along with pages of product reviews that include Troy Lee Designs’ new A3 helmet.
